intro: Luzuriaga montana, commonly known as the alpine snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern North America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Luzuriaga montana has small, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
